summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York informing recipients that Ghislaine Maxwell's attorneys intend to file a new bail application. The email provides advance notice as the application has not yet been filed and no schedule is set.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the email is her attorneys' intention to file a new bail application on her behalf.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the email, informing recipients about the upcoming bail application filing from the Southern District of New York.

connections.description: The prosecutor is communicating about legal proceedings (bail application) involving the defendant, Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Notice of Intent to File Bail Application
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney emails recipients to inform them that Ghislaine Maxwell's attorneys intend to file a new bail application.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's attorneys intended to file a new bail application as of December 3, 2020.
The communication is an advance notice from a federal prosecutor; the application had not yet been filed and no briefing schedule or hearing date was set.
The correspondence originates from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, indicating ongoing federal prosecution.
